title: Curry injures hamstring; Game 2 status in doubt

title: Canes' dominant 33-shot effort 'paid off' in OT

content: In the early hours of Wednesday morning, India launched a military operation targeting terrorist infrastructure across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK).

title: Why Operation Sindoor Is Unlike Any Mission India Has Ever Carried Out
content: Unlike the 2016 Uri surgical strikes, 2019 Balakot airstrikes, or other past Indian operations, which were limited in scale and scope, Operation Sindoor was technologically robust, expansive and unlike any mission India has ever carried out.

content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has shared a one-line message for the world hours after Indian armed forces struck multiple terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir in response to the Pahalgam attack.

content: Pakistan has been trying to target assets of the United Nations in Jammu and Kashmir after Indian forces struck terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir earlier this morning, defence sources said.

title: How the judiciary maintains accountability
content: All judicial powers have been vested in the Constitution, and judges are bound to work within that constitutional ambit. Once any of them go beyond it, they may be removed on the grounds of proved misbehaviour, which would include violation of the Constitution

title: 25 minutes, 9 terror camps, at least 70 terrorists: How Army executed Operation Sindoor
content: Indian armed forces executed 'Operation Sindoor', dismantling nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK in a swift 25-minute operation. Foreign Secretary Misri cited the Pahalgam attack as the impetus, emphasizing the need to deter further cross-border terrorism. Colonel Qureshi detailed the targeted sites, while Wing Commander Singh highlighted the strategic rationale and precision of the operation, ensuring minimal civilian impact.

title: Op Sindoor: 10 family members, 4 aides of Masood Azhar killed in Indian strikes
content: Jaish-e-Mohammad chief Azhar Masood reported the deaths of ten family members and four associates in 'Operation Sindoor,' conducted by the Indian Army. The strikes targeted a Jaish-e-Mohammed training center in Bahawalpur, Pakistan, following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen. The Indian Army targeted nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir.

title: Anand Mahindra on Operation Sindoor: Our prayers are with ...
content: Following the launch of Operation Sindoor by the Indian government, Anand Mahindra, Chairman of Mahindra Group, voiced his support for the Indian Armed Forces. He conveyed a message of solidarity on Twitter, emphasizing national unity. Operation Sindoor targeted terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir in response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

title: Did Pakistan shoot down Rafale jet during Operation Sindoor? PIB fact check says no
content: Following Indian Army's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, Pakistani media and social platforms spread false claims of retaliatory strikes. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) debunked these claims, including alleged attacks on Srinagar Airbase and downing of an Indian Rafale jet.

title: Pakistan shuts airspace for 48 hours; several Asian airlines avoid route
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor targeting terror locations, Pakistan initially shut down its airspace for 48 hours, causing widespread flight disruptions and diversions. While restrictions were briefly lifted, Lahore's airspace faced another closure. Numerous international carriers rerouted flights.

title: Sehwag reacts on 'Operation Sindoor': 'Agar koi aap par patthar ... '
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor" on May 7, targeting terror launchpads across Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. Virender Sehwag and other prominent cricketers, including Gautam Gambhir and Harbhajan Singh, lauded the armed forces' precise execution. The operation, which strategically avoided breaching Pakistani airspace, targeted infrastructure of banned groups, conveying a strong message of accountable counter-terrorism.

title: Microsoft HR now 'bans' employees who are ...
content: Microsoft is implementing a two-year rehire ban for underperforming employees and tracking "good attrition," signaling a stricter management approach. This policy shift, revealed in internal documents, mirrors similar practices at other tech giants like Amazon and Meta. The company is also offering struggling employees a separation package as an alternative to performance improvement plans.

title: HAMMER & SCALP: Weapons India used to target terror sites in Pak, PoK
content: India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in retaliation for the Pahalgam attack. The operation destroyed multiple LeT and JeM training facilities, hitting nine sites with precision weaponry. Indian forces used SCALP cruise missiles, HAMMER precision-guided bombs, and loitering munitions, avoiding engagement with Pakistani military installations. The mission was described as focused, measured, and non-escalatory.

title: Kartarpur corridor shut after Operation Sindoor
content: The Kartarpur corridor in Punjab's Gurdaspur was reportedly shut on Wednesday following India’s precision missile strikes on nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK under Operation Sindoor. The strikes came two weeks after the Pahalgam terror attack. The corridor, opened in 2019 for visa-free pilgrimage, typically allows up to 5,000 Indian pilgrims daily to visit Kartarpur.

title: Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia: ‘In the US, Teachers don’t correct mistakes, they value…’
content: Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia criticizes India's education system for prioritizing rote learning and obedience over critical thinking and creativity. He argues that the system produces conformist individuals ill-equipped for innovation, unlike the West, where children are encouraged to express ideas freely. Bhatia believes this stifles entrepreneurial spirit and perpetuates a fear of failure, hindering India's progress.

title: Airports shut, flights cancelled: How Op Sindoor impacted air travel in north India
content: Following Operation Sindoor, several airlines have suspended air travel to northern India due to airport closures and airspace restrictions. IndiGo cancelled approximately 160 domestic flights, impacting services to high-alert zones. Air India, Alliance Air, SpiceJet, Air India Express, and Akasa Air also cancelled or rerouted flights, offering refunds and rescheduling options to affected passengers.

title: Operation Sindoor: Terror sites targeted by Indian forces “linked” to banned outfits such as JeM, LeT, and Hizbul Mujahideen
content: The Indian Armed Forces on Wednesday launched ‘Operation Sindoor’, hitting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir

content: The Indian Armed Forces on Wednesday launched ‘Operation Sindoor’, hitting terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir

content: The judge was responding to submissions made by advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara, appearing for residents of Kerala living in the vicinity of the dam, to have the Chief Ministers and Prime Minister sit together and find a solution

title: Operation Sindoor: Flights cancelled at 13 airports in northern India till May 10
content: All airlines have offered free rescheduling of flights as well as the option of seeking a full refund

content: A hundred barges will be deployed in a phased manner across national waterways; the MoU between the Inland Waterways Authority of India and Rhenus Logistics targets the movement of over one million tonnes of cargo annually by the end of 2025

title: Six killed, over 30 injured in Pak shelling; Indian Army responding in equal measure: Officials
content: Indian armed forces carried out missile attacks early on May 7 on 9 terror targets in Pakistan and PoK, including Bahawalpur which is a major base of Jaish-e-Mohammad terror outfit

title: Punjab CM Mann trying to create differences among people, says Haryana CM Saini
content: Mr. Saini has also alleged that the AAP government in Punjab is failing its electoral base of farmers, and will face defeat in next Punjab elections

title: Villagers oppose plan to build bus shelter near a Tasmac outlet
content: Villagers fear safety of commuters, especially women, will be compromised. Collector says objections have been taken up with the district administration

title: Telangana invites citizens to apply online for curated entry to Miss World 2025
content: Citizens can register on Telangana Tourism website to be considered through a curated selection process

title: Operation Sindoor: Full list of 9 terror sites targeted by Indian Army in Pakistan, PoK
content: Under 'Operation Sindoor,' the Indian Armed Forces targeted nine terror facilities linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. These strikes, conducted after the Pahalgam massacre, aimed to dismantle terrorist infrastructure used for planning attacks against India. The targeted locations included Markaz Subhan Allah in Bahawalpur and Syedna Bilal Camp in Muzaffarabad.

title: Inside Operation Sindoor: How India carried out precision strikes on Pak
content: In a retaliatory move for the Pahalgam terror attack, India launched "Operation Sindoor," executing precision strikes on nine terrorist bases across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to....
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Operation Sindoor impact: Why Nifty, Sensex are unlikely to be hit too much
content: Operation Sindoor impact: Despite Indo-Pak military tensions, Indian markets have historically shown resilience, with the Nifty 50 experiencing modest declines followed by strong recoveries. Operation Sindoor had minimal impact, as markets focus on economic fundamentals and capital flows.

title: Over 15 Maoists gunned down in ‘biggest ever’ operation in Chhattisgarh's Bastar
content: A major anti-Maoist operation, 'Operation Sankalp,' launched on April 21 in the Bijapur district of Chhattisgarh, has resulted in the killing of more than 15 Maoists on Wednesday, bringing the total recovered bodies to 19. Security forces, including DRG, STF, CoBRA, and CRPF, have been targeting Maoist strongholds, destroying hideouts, and recovering explosives.

title: 'Targets chosen on credible intel': Govt shares details of 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following the Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepali citizen, India launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Foreign Secretary Misri cited intelligence of impending attacks, justifying the strikes as a necessary deterrent.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Gorklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Govt releases footage of Army bombing terror camps in Pakistan & PoK
content: The Indian Armed Forces announced "Operation Sindoor," targeting Lashkar-e-Taiba and Jaish-e-Mohammed terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Colonel Sofiya Qureshi presented video evidence of successful strikes on terror camps, clarifying that no military installations were targeted and no civilian casualties were reported.

title: Operation Sindoor: Why these 9 terror hideouts were chosen by the Army
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, the Indian Army and IAF launched 'Operation Sindoor,' destroying nine terror hideouts linked to JeM, LeT, and Hizbul Mujahideen in Pakistan and PoK. The strikes targeted key training and operational centers, including Markaz Subhan Allah and Markaz Taiba, used for indoctrination, training, and planning attacks like the Pulwama bombing.

title: Who is Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, IAF chopper pilot at 'Operation Sindoor' briefing
content: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh jointly led the media briefing on 'Operation Sindoor,' India's retaliatory strike on terror camps in Pakistan and PoK, following the Pahalgam massacre. The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts, including camps linked to the 26/11 attacks.

title: Adnan Sami lauds ‘Operation Sindoor’ takes dig at Pakistani news anchors
content: Adnan Sami, the singer, has voiced support for 'Operation Sindoor'. This operation targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood figures, including Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar, have also praised the Indian Armed Forces. The Ministry of Defence stated that the operation was a response to the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

title: Who's Col Sofiya Qureshi? Army officer who briefed world on 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Wing Commander Vyomika Singh and Colonel Sofiya Qureshi briefed the media on Operation Sindoor, India's decisive response to the Pahalgam terror attack. The operation targeted and destroyed nine terror hideouts in Pakistan and PoK, focusing on Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen. Col Qureshi, known for her leadership in multinational exercises and peacekeeping missions, exemplifies India's commitment to women in military roles.

title: Operation Sindoor impact on IPL: With airports shut, Dharamsala travel plans hit
content: While Punjab Kings (PBKS) and Delhi Capitals (DC) are already there for their match on May 8, Mumbai Indians (MI) were scheduled to reach later this week. Now with Dharamsala airport, and neighbouring Amritsar and Chandigarh airports shut, the teams and the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) would look to swing a plan in action.

title: 'It is a crime': Hardik Pandya loses his cool
content: Mumbai Indians faced a narrow defeat against Gujarat Titans, with captain Hardik Pandya lamenting the costly no-balls bowled by the team. Despite a spirited bowling performance led by Jasprit Bumrah and Trent Boult, MI fell short while defending a sub-par total of 155/8. Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya described the no-balls bowled by him and his teammates as a "crime" following their three-wicket defeat via the DLS method against Gujarat Titans in a thrilling contest at the Wankhede Stadium.

title: Operation Sindoor vs Balakot: India raises the stakes with deep strikes in Pakistan
content: Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, targeting terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir. This action avenged the Pahalgam terror attack. Strikes hit JeM and LeT headquarters, plus Hizbul Mujahideen sites. India used precision munitions and loitering drones. The operation aimed to dismantle terror infrastructure. It signifies a major escalation beyond previous cross-border actions.

title: Sachin Tendulkar reacts to 'Operation Sindoor': ‘No room for terrorism’
content: Sachin Tendulkar and other cricketers applaud Operation Sindoor. The operation retaliated against the Pahalgam terror attack. Indian Air Force targeted terror launchpads in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The strikes focused on Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba infrastructure. Defence officials confirm targets were carefully selected. It reinforces India’s counter-terrorism policy. Operation Sindoor sparks national unity.

title: Osman Nagar reservoirs getting ready for inauguration
content: Built at a cost of ₹30 crore, under the ORR phase 2 and package 2 project, the reservoirs will provide drinking water to nearly 1 lakh people in the area

title: BMTC responds after video shows elderly man misbehaving with woman passenger
content: The incident reportedly took place on May 5 around 3.30 p.m. on bus number KA51 F 6204, operating on route 276/22 near Vidyaranyapura

title: Early monsoon? Rains over Nicobar islands by May 13
content: The normal onset date of the monsoon over Kerala is June 1, and it usually takes about 10 days for the system to reach Kerala from the Nicobar islands

title: Health and education are foundations of a good society: Azim Premji
content: 63,982 candidates awarded certificates at the 27th convocation of Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences

title: CBI special court sentences Gali Janardhan Reddy, three others to seven-year jail term in illegal mining case
content: Apart from the BJP MLA from Karnataka, his relative B.V. Srinivas Reddy, MD, Obulapuram Mining Corporation; V.D. Rajagopal, then Director of the Mining Department; and Janardan Reddy’s personal assistant, Ali Khan, were also convicted in the case registered by the CBI nearly 16 years ago

title: ICAR expels farmers’ member, who questioned genome-edited seeds, from governing body
content: The Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) expelled Varanasi-based farmer Venugopal Badaravada from the governing body as well as general body of the ICAR Society for sending various mails levying ‘frivolous, baseless and materially unsupported allegations’ against various authorities of the Centre, Department of Agricultural Research and Education and the ICAR over the last seven-eight months

title: Kodanad case: CB-CID questions Jayalalithaa’s former personal assistant Poongundran
content: According to sources, he was asked to give the details of the Kodanad bungalow’s CCTV camera system and whether any important documents were stored there

title: Over 10 crore pages of historic documents digitised by National Archives of India, says Culture Minister
content: Making the announcement, Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said the digitisation project was taken up to make historic documents in possession of the NAI more accessible to the public.

title: Stalin government steps into fifth year, focuses on inclusive and equitable development
content: The Chief Minister said his sole aim was to bring Tamil Nadu back onto the path of progress and the four-year journey of the Dravidian model stood testimony to his administration’s success

title: PM Modi speaks to Emir of Qatar as India steps up West Asia outreach
content: Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani expresses full support to India’s fight against terrorism and all actions to bring the perpetrators of Pahalgam attack to justice; New Delhi rejects OIC statement as absurd

title: Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to rumours of Dipika Kakar's Label DKI shutting down
content: Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim's ethnic apparel brand, Label DKI, faced rumors of shutting down, which Shoaib addressed in an Instagram Q&A. He clarified that the brand is not closing but experiencing delays in new stock. Shoaib also mentioned considering a discount sale on existing stock before launching fresh designs, dismissing the fake news circulating about the brand's closure.

title: Kangana says ‘zero tolerance to terror’, wishes forces ‘safety & success’
content: Following the devastating Pahalgam attack, the Indian Armed Forces launched 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This precision mission aimed to dismantle key bases used for planning attacks against India. Bollywood celebrities, including Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar, have lauded the armed forces' decisive action and expressed solidarity with the nation.

title: Pakistan stock market crashes 5% after India strikes terrorist camps
content: Following India's military operations targeting terrorist facilities in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, the Pakistani stock market plummeted by 5%. In contrast, Indian markets displayed resilience, quickly recovering.

title: Explosions, smoke, panic: Viral videos capture India’s 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Under 'Operation Sindoor,' the Indian Armed Forces executed precise military strikes on terrorist hideouts in Pakistan and PoK, targeting JeM and LeT leaders. The coordinated operation involved the Army, Navy, and Air Force, focusing on infrastructure used for planning attacks against India. The Ministry of Defence emphasized strategic restraint, avoiding Pakistani military facilities.

title: Seven dead, 38 injured as Pak Army targets civilian areas along LoC in J&K
content: Pakistani forces shelled villages along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. Seven people died, including a woman and two children. Thirty-eight others sustained injuries. Poonch district experienced the most casualties. Indian Army retaliated to the ceasefire violations. The violations started after India conducted missile strikes on terror targets. Ten people were injured in Uri sector.

title: Operation Sindoor: Cricketers react after India strikes terror camps in Pakistan
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, Indian armed forces executed missile strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and PoK under 'Operation Sindoor'. The Defence Ministry confirmed the strikes, emphasising they were focused and non-escalatory, specifically targeting terrorist infrastructure. Several prominent figures, including cricketers like Virender Sehwag, have reacted to the news on social media.

title: Operation Sindoor impact on stock market: Sensex drops over 300 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, swung between red and green on Wednesday. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Investments Limited says, "What stands out in “Operation Sindoor” from the market perspective is its focused and non-escalatory nature.

title: Bhuvneshwar credits Virat Kohli for India's Test transformation
content: Bhuvneshwar Kumar credits Virat Kohli for transforming India's Test cricket with his aggressive mindset and focus on winning overseas. Kumar, who last played internationally in 2022, acknowledges emerging talents while quietly making an impact in IPL 2025 with 12 wickets in 10 games. Despite past injuries, he remains philosophical, focusing on present performance and expressing no regrets about his career.

title: Gill joins Kohli, Iyer in elite club after reaching major milestone
content: Shubman Gill joined Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer as the only IPL captains under 26 to score 500+ runs in a season. Gill's 43 against MI helped GT in a rain-affected chase of 156, where Rahul Tewatia and Gerald Coetzee secured a final-ball victory by three wickets. GT now leads the table, while MI's six-match winning streak ends.

title: 'Operation Sindoor is tribute to women like my mother': Son of Pune victim
content: Following India's precision strikes on terror bases in Pakistan and PoK, Kunal Ganbote, son of a Pahalgam attack victim, hailed the operation 'Sindoor' as justice. The tri-services operation targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba, aiming to dismantle terror infrastructure linked to the deadly attack that killed 26, including six from Maharashtra.

title: IPL playoffs scenarios: A look at the probabilities
content: With the league stage nearing its end, Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad are out of playoff contention. Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Gujarat Titans, and Punjab Kings are likely to advance, while Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals have a chance. Lucknow Super Giants and Kolkata Knight Riders face slim odds, with 16,384 possible result combinations remaining.

title: 'Pagal nhi bola': Rahul Vaidya reveals why he called Virat Kohli 'joker'
content: Singer Rahul Vaidya faced backlash after calling Virat Kohli a "joker" in a video mocking the cricketer's accidental like on actress Avneet Kaur's photo. Vaidya sarcastically blamed Instagram's algorithm, further escalating the situation. After revealing Kohli blocked him, Vaidya's comment about Kohli's fans being "bigger jokers" triggered angry reactions, including personal attacks.

title: Operation Sindoor: India avenges Pahalgam terror attack, strikes 9 sites in Pak
content: In response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 25 Indians and one Nepalese citizen, Indian Armed Forces initiated 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir. The strikes were described as focused and non-escalatory, avoiding Pakistani military facilities.

title: 'Weapon systems of all three forces used in Op Sindoor': What we know
content: India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting nine terrorist infrastructure sites in Pakistan, following the Pahalgam attack that killed 25 Indian citizens and one Nepali national. The Ministry of Defence emphasized the operation was precise, restrained, and non-escalatory, focusing on locations used for planning attacks against India. A detailed briefing is scheduled, with the Indian Army declaring, "Justice is served."

title: Emigration Act 1983 designed to address demands of particular geography in a certain era, says External Affairs Minister
content: S. Jaishankar says countries like Italy, Japan, Spain, and Malaysia among others have expressed interest in hiring Indian professionals in both blue collar and white collar positions and described these opportunities as just the ‘tip of the iceberg’

title: Pahalgam terror attack: CRPF seeks explanation from its first responder
content: Commandant Rajesh Kumar with a team of 22 people had rushed to the scene of massacre; eyewitnesses and survivors say security personnel reached the scene after more than an hour

title: Civil defence drills to be organised in five districts of Karnataka
content: In Karnataka, Mallapura, Shaktinagara and Bengaluru have been included in Category II civil defence towns

title: Power 4 coaches on the NFL draft: Intel on Shedeur Sanders' slide, sleeper picks and six schools' classes
content: the draft kicks off just as college football's spring transfer portal window was set to close . college coaches were focused on the final few pieces of their rosters for the 2025 season . the transfer portal itself is also a factor, as the increased movement of players exposes them to more coaches .

title: Things got 'awkward': Jim Knowles opens up about move from Ohio State to Penn State
content: Ohio State defensive coordinator Jim Knowles opted to leave for Penn State . Knowles is widely regarded as one of the top defensive coordinators in the country . his defense last year ranked No. 1 in points allowed per game, yards allow per game .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Haliburton drills last-second 3-pointer to stun Cavs in Game 2
content: Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 121-112 on tuesday night . Golden State defeated the No. 6-seeded Minnesota Timberwolves 99-88 . the 4-seed Denver Nuggets toppled the Oklahoma City Thunder in the West after a fourth quarter surge .

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time tuesday . wehiwa aloy and Kuhio Aloy are among the best players on the team's roster . cnn's david mccarthy takes a look back at some of the best plays from u.s. players .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: a pair of young hitters who put on power displays over the weekend are among the top fantasy baseball pickups . they're beginning to flourish at the big-league level, albeit for different teams . the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here, or start a brand new tradition .

title: Our final college softball rankings of the 2025 regular season: Top 25 poll and what to watch
content: the final week of play brought upsets (sorry, Oklahoma and UCLA) and standout performances (shoutout to Texas' Mia Scott). there's a new no. 1 team yet again with Texas A&M moving up after winning its weekend series over Tennessee .

title: NBA playoff odds: Big changes after Game 1 wins by Knicks, Nuggets
content: the defending champion Boston Celtics squandered a 20-point lead against the new york Knicks . the Cleveland Cavaliers look to even the series against the Indiana Pacers after losing on their homecourt in the series opener .

title: Returning the Bundesliga crown to Bayern is a job well done for Kompany
content: germany's most successful club tasting success as Sofa-Meister (couch champions) celebrated as a group on Sunday at the Käfer restaurant in desirable Bogenhausen . on Saturday, the party proper will commence in front of 75,000 at the allianz Arena against Borussia Monchengladbach .

title: Grand Theft Auto VI releases information on main characters
content: a new trailer for the game has been released, showcasing the two main characters . the duo is described as wanting "an easy life" that somehow keeps avoiding him . "Meeting Lucia could be the best or worst thing to ever happen to him," the description says .
